system.description:
A 6’ diameter circle of fine black cloth, often found folded down to the size of a handkerchief. The cloth can be placed upon a surface (floor, wall, ceiling, etc.) to conjure an extra-dimensional hole.

  • Placing on a surface: Creates a 6’ diameter, 10’ deep hole in the surface.

  • Picking up: When placed upon a surface, the cloth can be picked up by a creature inside or outside of the hole. The hole then disappears from the surface it was placed on.

  • Anything inside the hole: Remains in an extra-dimensional space when the cloth is picked up.

  • Living creatures in the hole: Can unfold the cloth (if they have it) to recreate the hole at its last location. The hole contains enough air for one turn.
